name: Blundering Terror
description: A Pakled ship is stranded on an asteroid on its way to show off their superior might and intelligence to the Federation. Irony aside, could this be some sort of trap?
rules:
-- Unique Supply Missions are available during the event. Open the Event to access them.
-- Using any version of Grebnedlog, T. Paris, Scotty, or crew with the Thief trait will provide a bonus to Supply Missions.
-- Every Supply Mission you complete earns you Event Victory Points. Collect Event Victory Points to unlock Threshold Rewards!
-- Community Rewards are only available during Phase 1. Collect Event Victory Points to unlock these rewards before the phase change!
-- In this event, Squadrons may also compete to advance up the Squadron leaderboards. Join a Squadron to get more rewards!
bonus_text: Crew Bonus: Grebnedlog, T. Paris, Thief or Scotty
rewards_teaser: Reach Rank 1 by gaining Victory Points from Event Supply Missions!

featured_crew.name: Scotty
featured_crew.flavor: Posing as 'Professor' Scott, he helped build a tank to transport humpback whales to the 23rd century.

adventures.name: Scanning for Weapons
adventures.description: Scan the Pakled ship to learn their offensive capabilities.

adventures.name: Show of Force
adventures.description: Conduct torpedo maintenance as a deterrent.

adventures.name: Truth in Data
adventures.description: Hack into the Pakled computer and inspect their data.

adventures.name: Grebnedlog's Ship
adventures.description: Repair the Pakled ship enough to escape.

rewards.flavor: Event Victory Points

adventures.description: Deliver Federation shuttles as backup vehicles.

adventures.description: Repair the Pakled ship enough to escape.

rewards.name: Blundering Terror

rewards.name: Scotty
rewards.flavor: Posing as 'Professor' Scott, he helped build a tank to transport humpback whales to the 23rd century.

rewards.name: 10x Portal
rewards.flavor: 10 valuable items. Go to Time Portal to collect!

goals.flavor: Offer standard-issue Starfleet help via the Federation.
See if there's some latinum to be made with the Ferengi.
Risk Pakled assimilation by letting the <b>Borg<b> help.

next_threshold_rewards.name: Chronitons
next_threshold_rewards.flavor: Chronitons allow your crew to take action in these chaotic times. Use Chronitons to replay parts of past missions via the Timeline.

screens.text: "We are strong. We will show you. We need help. But we are strong."
"Yeah, they're so strong that they managed to get themselves stranded on an asteroid, and need Starfleet to rescue them."
"Stronger than we are, my boy. They've made it this far despite their deficiences, and you can't help but admire their bold-faced confidence, even when they have nothing."
"Of course we'll help them, but that first bit, about being strong and showing us... I might call that a threat. We should rule that out first, before we get them flying again."
"You see we are strong. Make us go. We will spare you."
"Well, that's a step forward, isn't it? Not that they really posed any serious threat, but I always like to make a new friend."

responses.text: "Because that's not the Federation way. We can't leave them to die."
"That worked out well for Kirk and Khan Noonien Singh, as I recall."
"I agree. I know I definitely have better things to do."

screens.text: "The Pakled aren't friends, they're scavengers. The last time they encountered the Federation, they kidnapped the flagship's chief engineer. Why shouldn't we just leave them on the asteroid?"
"I wasn't suggesting leaving anyone to die. But it's time they learned how to do something for themselves."
"Even if we made them our enemies, what threat could they possibly be?"

"I don't know about you two, but I joined Starfleet to explore and discover. The Pakled are some of the most interesting people I've met in a while. There's something to be learned from everyone, no matter how they might appear on the surface."

"We promised to help Grebnedlog fix his ship, and we've got to finish that mission. We don't have to shoulder the burden ourselves, others are willing to help... but I don't know that they're the kind I want influencing the Pakled...."
